1.content:
Space, final frontier and so on and so on.

Well we find ourselfs in the far away future of the year 2509. Mankind finally could unite and act as one voice in the galaxy. The future science got improved in many ways. The probably most important invention was the Omijumpdrive, which allowed a ship to skip 100 of lightyears in a few minutes. But also on the weapon sector made great strides. So every earthship is equiped with deadly plasmaparticlelaunchers and destructive zerropoint rockets.

But now it seems there is comeing some kind of new conflict with "The Directive".The Directive is a group of six alien species (the Favooda, the Tre'Joo'Van, the Oos, the Xayotites, the Mandatoress and the Liiress, the leader species) who never really have spoken their happyness about the power gaining of Earth. Earth Intelligence has collected different signs, that The Directive has started to produce a great armada of battleships, which only could forfil the reason of attacking the mankind. Spacenaut Headquater set DefCon to level 2.

So make up your decision on which playfield you want to act:

1) ESS Ionstorm

Clasification heavy cruiser

Captained by John Evers

Crew: 2300

Your mission is the investigation of the border between the Human and the Directive territories. Everything seems to be calm, but something tells you that a storm is about to come.

2) ESS Sherlock Holmes

Clasification scout vessle

Captained by Henry Towns

Crew: 65

After the report of EI (Earth Inteligence) that The Directive is building an assault fleet, the Spacenaut Headquater needs more information to be able to make up a defence plan. Your ship has to get deep into Directive territory and spy the situation. It will be very important, that you are not detected and get as much information about the enemy as possible.

3) ESS Nova

Clasification light cruiser

Captained by Lukas Hawking

Crew: 240

You are on a deep space mission, exploring the galaxy. Actually you mustn't care alot about the conflict that far away from Earth, or should you? Your crew detected some strange space anomaly which no one has ever seen before.

4) ESS Newton

Clasification medium cruiser

Captained by Angela Moon

Crew: 680

You are simply one of the lucky ones beond the Spacenaut captains because your duty is to patrol around Earth, what meens, that you can go home every weekend. But you don't want to take your work too easy. After all your sensor officer had detected some strange neutrino signatures...

5) ESS Holly Crow

Clasification escort vessle (prototype)

Captained by Lana Caine

Crew: 120

You are young, you are unexperienced. This is your fist command. You have gotten a new ship, a new crew. You are actually on a training mission to test the defence and offence skills of the new shiptype. You have also some new weapons on board which are that secret, that even you don't know anything about them. You are escorted by the ESS Thunderbolt. An old ship with an old, but experienced captain: Thomas Evens. You are in the out of nowhere, practiseing tactical manoeuvres. But maybe this area of the galaxy is not that forgotten.
1.title: Which Course Captain

choices: Keep the contracts, stay on human territory
11.content:
Captain's Log, April the 17th 2509

Captain Evers

Three weeks have past sice we entered this
sector. Till now there were no signs of
Directive activities. This whole mission
seems to me like a bloody waste of time. It
wouldn't match to the Directive actions to
take the direct way. If they attack, they
surely won't take this route. But job is job
and so I have finally time to end my work on
the hyperspace paralaxies therory for the 9th
and 10th dimension.

Captain Evers, a 35 year old experienced officer of the Spacenauts entered the bridge with a quite boring look in his face. Three weeks! That were 21 days and all what they had found was a tiny pice of a comet. This truely was a waste of recources. No ships in sensor distance, neither enemy nor friendly. No planets, no systems. Not even the smallest quantum singularity. This part of the galaxy was really empty. No use to observe it.

Evers really was a bit angry. The Ionstorm was a ship of the Predatorclass, a heavy destroyer. Maybe the best equiped ship of the whole human fleet. Such a ship shouldn't be missioned for some irrelevant border controlings. And his crew surely was the same mind. He could see it in their faces. They all seemed to be loosing their nerves. It wouldn't take long till real problems would apear.

A he sat down on his chair, the holography infront of him seemed to show still the same picture as it had as he last left the bridge three hours ago, olthough the ship muast have moved over a distance of about 700 million kilometers. It really was frustrating.

"Sir", Lt. Free reported suddenly.
"Go ahead Lieutenant!" Evers didn't even try to hide his frustration as he talked to his officer.
"Sir, I think I have there thomething on the longrange sensor array."
"Exciting", Evers said with a quite boring sound in his voice.
"So what's it? Another three inch comet?"

Commander Landan, the first officer next to him couldn't resist a laughter. Evers ignored him.

"No Sir", Free answered.
"It's a kind of... radiation."
"What kind of radiation?"
"I'm not sure."
"Then get sure!"
"I think it's a tachyon emission."
"Tachyon? A local tachyon spot?"
"Yes Sir."
"How is that possible? Tachyons travel with superlightspeed. They don't stay on one place."
"Theese do."
"Maybe there is something that is responcible for this anomaly."
"Maybe. Where is this tachyon emission Lieutenant?"
"Direction 043.006, distance 190 million kilometers. And Sir, it's on Directive territory."
"So is it?"

Evers had to think. This truely was something strange. After all it could be some new weapon of the Directive. But for nearer investigation they would have to pass the border. And this would be in a conflict to the contracts. A conflict which in the current situation could easily break off the war.
So what should he do?
11.title: Border Patrol

choices: It radios and the voices are...human?
This dreadnought contacts you...and it's occupied by new aliens
111.content:
"We don't want to start a war out here all alone. We stay on our side of the border," Evers declared. Despite his even voice, Evers was shaken. He didn't like old things behaving in new ways. Especially on his patrols.
"Sir, the radiation is gone," Landan said. His eyes flicked over numerous screens, and a look of horror stole over his face. "CONTACT OVER THE BORDER! FIFTY CRUISERS!" The alarms blared and the bridge sprang to life. Clearly visible through the forward view screens were the shapes of a fleet of cruisers that rivaled Evers' ship. They steered towards the lone human ship. Evers was filled with dread, and went through the motions of combat while already mentally saying goodbye to all his loved ones. His silent thoughts were interrupted by commander Landan yelling again.
"The tachyon spot is back, our side of the border. Less than 500 miles distance." Evers simply rubbed his eyes and wondered what death would be like. All of a sudden, the transparent dome over the bridge lit up a brilliant blue. I swirl of lights appeared, and the ship was rocked like a dinghy in a tsunami. The Directive ships were also affected, and some of the closer ones collided. Finally, the lights faded and above Evers's ship, there was a section of the night that was totally black, not even stars. Across the border, the Directive ships fired all their weapons at once. The arcs of plasma and burning missile trails seared spots into Evers' eyes. He closed them and braced for the end. When nothing happened, he opened them and saw they had exploded on whatever was above his ship. Slowly, running lights lit up on the darkness and illuminated a massive ship above the human cruiser. Now, three points of light flashed on its forward surface and three white trails sped through space to impact on the Directive ships. What happened next was only describable as Hell.
The first ship to get hit by the light was destroyed instantly. Its shields flared, died, and the ship exploded. The same happened to the other ships unfortunate enough to get hit by these weapons. While the Directive ships recovered from the until shock, this new ship was further illuminated by lines of plasma traveling through transport tubes. Then it erupted from dozens of points on the ship's surface and streaked into the Directive armada. The smaller ships were completely engulfed by the balls of plasma, but the bigger ones had a second to stay together before their metal structures were boiled away. Within minutes the armada was nothing but a collection of derelict hulls and clumps of liquified metal. The new ship seemed to stand down, the plasma lines cooling and almost appearing derelict itself.
111.title: Keep the contracts, stay on human territory

choices: Leave Directive space immediately without further investigation.
Launch the probe, Tell Volh you're lost and stall until the probe transmits
112.content:
"Take us to the anomaly, maximum speed Mister McKinley. Mister Free keep an eye on the long range sensors. Let me know the moment we're detected," barked Captain Evers. He punched the comm button. "Engineering, cut power to all non-essential systems. We need to reduce our sensor signature."
He glanced across the bridge to his executive officer. "Take us to yellow alert Mister Landan."
The Ionstorm's engines propelled the cruiser deep into Directive territory. The crew was anxious Evers knew that some of the crew had never been in a combat situation, something that this course of action could deteriorate into quickly.
"Any contacts on long range Mister Free?"
"No Captain. All clear."
"How long until we reach the anomaly Mister Mckinley?" asked Landan.
"Fourteen minutes, thirty seven seconds."
"Sensors telling us anything new Mister Free?"
"The anomaly measures five thousand cubic meters. Still no idea about what's keeping the tachyons localized."
"The area is roughly the size of a battlecruiser. slightly larger than our own volume Captain," Landan added.
"Or it could be a gateway that a ship our size could pass through," Evers mused aloud.
The Ionstorm plunged deeper into Directive space. The tension on the bridge could be cut with a knife.
"We are within visual distance Captain."
"Put it on the screen Mister Free"
They stared at the viewscreen.
"Nothing. I see nothing," said Landan.
"Increase the magnification," the Captain ordered.
"Still nothing,"Landan grunbled.
"Well sirs, tachyons are invisible to the naked eye. I had hoped there would be some kind of display where the particles interacted with whatever barrier is containing them," Free responded.
"No such luck eh free? Prepare a probe. Let's take a look inside," Evers commanded.
"Captain we have company. Directive vessel bearing 425.369 on an approach vector," Free said.
"Red alert! Battlestations! Tactical, report!" bellowed Landan.
"Directive Heavy Battle Destroyer. Four PPCs, one molecular cutter and heavy shields," responded Tactical Officer Walsh. "Not much of a threat but she could pack a nasty punch. Directive vessel still on approach."
"They have to know they are no match for us and still they come?" Landan observed.
"We have no declared state of hostilities between our governments, plus we're in their yard. They have to get in our face," replied the Captain.
"Communication from the Directive vessel. Commander Volh of HBD 105 demands we withdraw from Directive space immediately"
112.title: Investigate the anomaly

choices: Attempt to fire at the Xayotite destroyer
Attempt to escape on impulse speed
Attempt to ram the Xaytite ship
12.content:
The ESS Sherlock Holmes dropped out of Omijump near the Directive border.
"Scrambler code epsilon to Spacenaut Headquarters," Captain Henry Towns ordered. "ESS Sherlock Holmes successfully reached Directive Space. Must maintain radio silence from here on. Captain Henry Towns, February 6th, 2509. End transmission."
"Engaging cloaking device," the pilot, Lt. Zedrich said from his console."Full impulse speed on your command."
"Take her in, lieutenant," Towns said. The Sherlock Holmes glided forward, totally invisible, into enemy space. "Let me know when the sensors see something," Capt. Towns said, and left the bridge. He scratched his short, brown beard as he took the elevator to the lowest level, Deck 4. His executive officer, Lt. Cmdr. Leveret Muench was eating chicken soup in the deserted Mess Hall. Towns reached for the lighting control.
"Leave it dark, Henry," Muench muttered. Towns walked over to his friend and sat down across from him. Muench slurpped a noodle.
"You okay, Lev?" Towns asked. "Head cold?"
Muench shook his head. "Cratalman flu. Probably caught it on Starbase 752 last week."
"How do you feel?" Towns asked.
Muench pushed a chunk of frizzy, blond hair out of his eyes and said, "I feel like crap."
"Get some sleep, Lev," Towns told him. "That's an order," he added jokingly.
"Flu's given me insomnia."
"Then eat some chicken soup."
Muench forced a smile. Towns's comunicator beeped.
"Captain," a female voice said. "We're experiencing a power drain. Can you meet me in engineering in two minutes?"
"I'll be right there," Towns replied.
"Understood. Fulton out."
Towns stood, patted Muench on the back, and then jogged down the long, dim hallway to main engineering. An Asian woman was waiting for him.
"What's the problem, commander?" Towns asked.
"We're losing power to all vital systems, captain," she told him. "The strange part is, the drain appears to be occuring within the reactor. I don't understand it."
"From inside?" Towns asked. "Sabotage?"
"That's my theory, sir," she replied gravely.
"Switch to auxiliary power, commander."
"Aye, sir."
The Sherlock Holmes shook violently and the lights flickered.
"Bridge to Captain Towns," Lt. Zedrich's voice said over the communicator. "We are under attack."
"Red alert!" Towns bellowed. He ran to the elevator and hit the "Bridge" button.
He emerged on Deck One to find the Bridge in chaos.
"Report!" Towns ordered as he sat in his chair.
"One heavily armed Xayotite destroyer bearing down to starboard!" Zedrich replied.
The Sherlock Holmes shook again. The science console exploded and the lights went out.
"How the hell are they detecting us?!" Towns yelled.
"The cloaking device was destroyed after the first shot, captain," the tactical officer said.
"Tactical on thr Xayotite ship?"
"Type seven ion cannons, fourty rounds of antimatter torpedos, and electromagnetic sheild."
"Damage report," Towns ordered.
"Cloaking device destroyed, omijump drive leaking, sheilds down to 11%, main power disabled, reactor core fractured." Zedrich said.
"What is our current weapons status?"
"We have five zerropoint rockets, sir," the tactical officer said.
"We're dead," Towns whispered to himself. "Unless..."
Muench came onto the bridge and knealt next to Towns. "You'd better have a plan," he said to him.
"Or I'm gonna puke."
"I think I might have a wild little idea."
The Sherlock Holmes shook again.
"Your orders, captain?" Lt. Zedrich asked.......
12.title: Sabotaged

choices: Continue on to the assigned coordinates cloaked
124.content:
"Engines full power! Maximum speed! Helm steer us straight at that ship!" Towns ordered.
"Captain!"
"Do it!"
"But Captain! Your clothes!"
Towns looked down and saw that he was totally naked. He took a deep breath and leaned forward in his bed. His pajamas and blankets were drenched in sweat.
"Captain to bridge. Status!" he asked.
"We crossed the border seven hours and forty minutes ago under cloak. We are on course to Kilgal Point. ETA three hours and twelves minutes. All sections reporting green and all sensors clear."
"No Xaytite destroyers huh?, Towns mumbled.
"Sir? The Xaytites are a hundred thousand light years in the other direction."
"Never mind Commander. Towns out".
"What a time to have a "naked on the bridge" nightmare", towns thought aloud. He chalked it up to the pressure of the assignment. Kilgal Point could be very dangerous if the intel was correct. If even a third of the ships purported to be there were actually there, the Sherlock Holmes might be detected by their enhanced sensor grid. There is no way she could fight her way out.
"Bridge to Captain."
"Go ahead Commander."
"Engineering is reporting a problem with the EMS refractor in the cloaking assembly. He says it might take only an hour to fix if we drop the cloak." said Muench.
"And if I don't want to become highly visible in the heart of Directive space Mister Muench? What then?"
"The entire cloaking system could fail and we may not be able to get it online outside of a starbase," He replied.
124.title: Attempt to ram the Xaytite ship

choices: decide to go the opposite direction
13.content:
Captain Lukas Hawking leaned back as far as his chair would tilt without falling over. He glared at the ceiling as if it was to blame for his position. One damn mistake and they send you out to BFE. 'So frickin' sorry that I tried to save another man's life.' He thought bitterly. He leaned forward over his desk and sighed resignedly.

"Oh well," he said to the empty room. "Better here than on Earth. All Hell's about to break loose in that neck of the woods." His thoughts were interrupted by a static-y sound from the comlink on the wall. Hawking went to it and said, "What do you want Carmichael?"

"Sir, we're getting a strange reading, and Lt. Collins thinks you should check it out."

"Hang on, I'll be right there." He walked out of his office languidly. Probably nothing. What the Hell would be out here? Other than unofficially banished cruiser pilots, that is.

"Alright, Collins, what is it?" He asked the skinny techy when he reached the control room.

"That's why I wanted you down here, Sir. I have no idea."

"Well, let's take a look and a listen." Hawking put on the sonar headphones as he messed with the radar control panel. "What the..." He muttered after a few seconds.

"Well Sir, what do you think?"

Hawking hesitated before saying,"Probably nothing."

"Should we go check it out?"
